qas.question: What kind of crop economy did the Island originally have?
What year did the crop economy change?
What was produced during the time the Island was monocrop?
Saint Helena's economy is now almost completely sustained by what?
How much % of production does the public sector cover?

context: The island had a <a0_0>monocrop<a0_0/> economy until <a1_0>1966<a1_0/>, based on the cultivation and processing of New Zealand <a2_0>flax<a2_0/> for rope and string. St Helena's economy is now weak, and is almost entirely sustained by <a3_0>aid from the British government<a3_0/>. The public sector dominates the economy, accounting for about <a4_0>50%<a4_0/> of gross domestic product. Inflation was running at 4% in 2005. There have been increases in the cost of fuel, power and all imported goods.
